{"step_by_step_thinking": "In this case, the child had fractured his maxillary central incisor 10 months ago and the pulp shows no response. There is no periapical lesion in the radiograph. Based on this information, the treatment of choice would be to perform a conventional root canal treatment. This is because the lack of pulp response indicates that the pulp is non-vital and cannot heal on its own. The absence of a periapical lesion suggests that there is no infection or inflammation in the surrounding tissues. Therefore, the best course of action would be to remove the non-vital pulp and perform a root canal treatment to prevent any further complications.", "answer_choice": "C"}
